user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I have been eyeing these palettes for at least a year now and have never committed to purchasing until the sale. I cannot explain the love that I have for Darya, so much so that I went to N.D. website to purchase the Citrus as well. The packaging is heavy enough to feel luxurious while feeling light enough for your arm not to get tired, its perfect, as is the compact and aesthetic of this palette - none other is like this one in my collection. The colors in the pan look far more intimidating than actually are on the skin. To start, I have red, textured cheeks and light yellow undertones and was skeptical these pink blushes would be too cold to look good on me. I was wrong. Both blushes are warm, extremely easy to work with and are not intensely pigmented, they are buildable and look like natural blush on the cheeks. I use a duo fiber brush for the cream blush and have had 0 issue same as a beauty sponge, although I do have to say that this is one of the palettes that you will need to be cleanly with as sometimes the cream can jump to the outer rim. The highlight formula is ridiculous, I don't typically love cream highlights but the N.D. formula is changing my view, it looks so natural and glistening as a base and even on its own. The powder highlights are as blinding as the ripples of waves in the sunlight if that makes sense. They do emphasize texture but not in a way thats chunky or chalky or not skin like, it is beautiful on my textured cheeks, and when I turn in the mirror I could stop traffic. The duo glow highlight is so unique and adds such a special effect as it warms up the icy highlights with a pink gold shift that adds to the palettes versatility. I like the diamond powder, I don't use it every time I pick up the palette but its a great bonus if you're feeling extra, and its not glittery or have insane fall out on the cheek, it stays put and doesn't look chalky. In summary, out of all my luxury cheek palettes, this is the true diamond in the rough.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I love this blush palette. It’s like butter melts into the skin!

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I researched for weeks because I was unsure if this palette would work for me. The promo photos are so over the top that I couldn't really tell its wearability. If you want this palette but are not 100% sure, I highly recommend you get it during the sale because you get so much product for its price right now. It is truly a wonderful product! 100 dollars CAD pre-sale seems expensive but I do understand it because the size is large. This was my first time using cream and wow I am in love. This palette has converted me lol. The blush blends soo well and it is buildable. It goes on sheer? light? at first so don't worry about looking like a "clown." But do use a light hand for all of the pans. The duo chrome doesn't really seem like an everyday blush, so I used it as eyeshadow and it was beautiful. The highlights are... intense! Go with a light, light, light hand if you want a more "natural" glow. I used them on my eyelids as well and wow my eyes look popping. I am regretting not getting a second palette because I love it that much. Sorry for the long review, I am just super excited that my long waited palette was worth it.

The colors did not work for my warm toned light skin and I prefer a more natural lit from within look personally.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_title: worth it if you can get it on sale
review_content:
When I first bought this I thought it was not great. However I've been using it more lately and now I quite like it. I use my fingers to apply the creamier products because this seems to give a better look than a sponge or brush. I like the diamond cream to give a subtle but very natural looking glow and use it alone or layered under matte powders. The cream blush is really nice layered under the powder blush in the palette or any other powder blush. I like the yellow cream to put on my eyelids where it seems to have a cool duo chrome effect and looks stunning when layered under touch in sol sun aurora (which has a similar looking gold- green shift). The blush is mostly shimmer but still pretty. Anyway I'm giving it 3 stars because the top three products in the palette are good. The highlighters are ok but better suited to a cooler skin tone than mine. I would not buy this full price but on sale it is not a bad deal.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I own both of these palettes, and the quality is top-tier. If you didn't know, the top row is CREAM and the bottom row is POWDER. The creams have a clear plastic flip-up cover to keep from being contaminated by the powders. This is awesome, and it WORKS. The palette is much larger than it looks in the photo, and you get a fair bit of product. It's also quite weighty, and feels well made. Both formulas are smooth and richly pigmented. Her blush formula is absolutely AMAZING; I'm not quite as keen on her highlight formula, which has more chunky glitter and less blinding shimmer. I personally don't like creams mixed with powders, as creams will expire long before powder, so half your palette is suddenly rendered useless space. I prefer powders to creams, but her cream formula is like a 'cream to powder' and works great over dry medium, like setting powder or powder foundation. You don't have much time to blend this way, so you need to use a light and careful hand if this is how you apply it. Overall I've been enjoying these palettes and what they bring to the table.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Highlighters are gorgeous, the cream blush is kind of orange & the powder one (at least in mine) is pressed too hard and doesn’t want to work. If I use my fingers it works as a highlight but otherwise won’t budge. I’m literally only keeping this because the other highlighters are sooo pretty especially the yellow (I was so scared of that one because I’m very fair) is like a tint of yellow with an amazing duo-chrome effect. The diamond highlighter powder is actually very creamy and came looking broken HOWEVER I literally could press it back into the pan as if nothing happened because of it being so creamy. Might just exchange it and see if I have better luck with the powder blush with a different one because the shade is gorgeous it just won’t pick up. I would only recommend this product if you are more interested in the highlighters because the blush is so disappointing.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
My drawer is suddenly overflowing with ND palettes and I love them all. This one was my first and I use five of six shades but not always at once--I think I'd glow too much if I did. Like in her others, there are cream and powder formulas. I use a small brush or a sponge with the cream formulas and pounce or daub the colour on so I don't disturb my foundation. The powders work well over-top or on their own and; on top they create a glass finish with the two combined. I love the glitter highlight on the lower left, and it is glittery, but I use it dabbed on my eyelids over a neutral flesh toned liquid eye shadow such as Stila's Nude Awakening. It just give a opening 'pop' to my eye, and never looks overdone. If you use this on your cheese you get a wet glittery finish, whic is also lovely. As with all NDs cream blushes, they are very pigments so start with very little on your brush/sponge and build it up. I rarely use the DIAMOND glow cream, as I prefer Charlotte Tilbury's Hollywood Flawless Filter--no product can touch that one, IMO.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I’ve been debating whether or not to get this palette for sooo long because of the price but when it went on sale I had to get it!!! I love blush but I always have issues with blushes having patchiness or being too matte/dry looking. These blushes in this palette were the answer to my prayers! The powder blush isn’t a true matte but it’s also not like a pick highlighter either, it give the cheeks a nice sheen almost and it makes your face look healthy and alive. The cream blush was a little intimidating to me at first but it’s honestly one of the easiest cream cheek products to use! I use the Morphe M427 Tapered Duo Blush Brush for the cream blush and it applies it effortlessly and helps me to not go in so heavy handed. I like layering the blushes but I also like them separately as well. Now the highlighters. The Diamond Powder (the extra glittery one) is really pretty but not my favorite personally. It’s definitely not a highlighter for the faint of heart. It also brings out the tiniest bit of texture from the skin but it’s not unbearable. I like the cream highlight, it adds an almost dewy, lit from within glow. I especially like layering the cream highlighter with the the powder highlighter in the bottom right of the palette. It’s soooo long lasting and it doesn’t look too crazy but it’s obviously there so if you don’t like a highlighter that WILL show up this palette is not for you. Anyways, I’m in love with this palette but I’m only giving it four stars because of the CRAZY price point (before it went on sale) and also because I see myself never wearing the duo chrome shade or the diamond powder. But other than those things I’m so happy I waited for it to go on sale before buying it and I absolutely love this palette!

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I bought the "Daria" palette at sale price. I'd give four stars considering the half price I got it, which means if this palette is sold at full price I can only give it 2-3 stars. It's still nice but not up to my expectation. The color range and idea is very good, but, it's just not pigmented as you'd think it should be. The hight lighters are not that shining as some other highlighters, and it won't last long. It'll disappear after just a a few hours. I am not that into the cream base products either. It'll be a little challenge to use both cream and powder together on your face. Therefore basically the two cream-based pans are a waste for me. I would only use the other four pans. The one I indeed enjoy is the "duo glow",which is indeed very beautiful. That's it. This palette only worth it if on half of its original price. I'll always have to think twice when purchasing any ND products considering the mixed reviews.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
This went on sale and I picked up both. I didn't realize it was the same blush color. I do feel these are really great, but one is geared more toward lighter skin tones and the other is for darker. I thought they worked for both (They can). but they seem to have the same blush color. This must have been created as the same type of palette for different skin tones in mind. versus being two completely different sets. I can't make sense of the same blush color with both otherwise. That might be good to know for future purchasing. I do love my Darya and have been using it daily. The diamond face powder feels more like a night product and has too much glitter for me during the day. I looked like a twilight character or the tin man. It would be gorgeous at night. But the highlight worked quite well. It can show texture if you have a lot of texture, but I'm almost 50 and I didn't feel it enhanced that in the least. It was a good highlight. There are two cream based colors (another highlight and blush) with a lavender shift glow (in Darya) - The cream highlight is very toned down and the lavender highlight feels special occasion for me or an eyelid topper shade. (I used it as that and it was quite pretty) The diamond face powder is more of a topper type of powder and can be used anywhere. The powder blush is meant to go on top of the cream (I think so, they match) and the powder highlight can be used on top of the cream one or alone. This is a fantastic face palette and very much so for the sale price. The quality is there with this. The Citrus one is pretty too, but he highlight is too dark for me. I have light skin and I can make it work with a tan, but the Darya seems to suit me better. The bright yellow in citrus is gorgeous and as with Darya, it's a glow with a shift and can be used however you wish. I love the cream bronze in citrus. I just wish the blush color was different. I could condone keeping both if it were. Great palette, catch this while it's on sale!
…read more
